data.title: Music & Events — .
data.text:
This Old Engine: Residency

​THIS OLD ENGINE

delivers their interpretation of the music of the Grateful Dead for an evergrowing base of devoted fans. Formed in 2015, TOE's experienced musicians are an assembly of some of the best players in north New Jersey's thriving live music scene. Together they form an eclectic jam band, pulling in members of The Samples, Jungle Jazz Initiative, Spare Tire Band and The Watchung Mountain Riders.

View Event →

Shotgun Red

HIGH ENERGY classic rock, 70’80’90’s cover band extrodanaire. This band simply rocks and bring the fire everytime. Shannon and her high power vocals will blow you away. This is one hellova fun band and you def dont want to miss this one.

View Event →

Rebellion

Carol Ann Suddeath and co take the stage in a high energy, high flying immersion of classic hits and new faithfuls. Come out and show this first time Pattenebug House band how we do things!

View Event →

Snakeman Blues Jam

Come on out and join Snakeman and the boys for a good old-fashioned of blues jam. Come and join the band or just sit and enjoy the tunes. This is one of our favorite days of the month!

View Event →

jImmy Leahey & Grey Man Group

Jimmy Leahy started playing guitar at age 7, learning from his dad, Harry... a well-known jazz player and a prolific teacher in New Jersey. Jimmy’s toured and recorded with John Waite, Patty Smyth, Martha Davis, Gloria Gaynor, Alison Krauss and has just retired from playing with Dennis DeYoung, from Styx

One of the most optimistic and genuine guys you’ll meet, Jimmy talks about the incredible positive influence his dad had on him, and also the pressure he often felt being “Harry’s son”... a great story about the best gig he had, playing as part of the house band for Bon Jovi’s birthday party - playing alongside Roger Waters, Billy Joel, and Paul McCartney…

View Event →

Brian Molnar & Slow ROLLING LOW

From humble beginings to worldwide tour Brian Molnar has done it all. A lyricist, musician, producer, and lead man its hard to find something this guy isnt good at. Tour companion to the one and only Kinky Friedman himself Brian is no stranger to fame. With a all-star cast of local talent BM and SRL command the stage at every show. Straditional county, folk ballads will leave you reeling, yearning, screaming out for more. We are so happy to host such amazing talent, do not sleep on these guys they are truely something special.

View Event →

JB Klien

J.B. Kline is a solid, seasoned performer with over 40 years of steady playing under his belt. Starting with local New Jersey bands whose members would go on to play with Bruce Springsteen and Patti LaBelle, Jeff moved to N.Y.C. and performed with such noted acts as the Drifters, Chuck Berry, Solomon Burke, the Crystals, Fats Domino, Bo Diddley, the Marvellettes, George Thorogood, and even the Beach Boys! Recently J.B. Kline has performed with Marshall Tucker, ("the best opening act we've ever had!" -Marshall Tucker), Shannon McNally, Big Brother & The Holding Company, Rick Derringer, Guitar Shorty, Johnny Winter, and B.B. King.

J.B. Kline has focused in on his roots, which are R&B, and blues based music. His CDs, "Music Mountain" and "Belvidere Line", all feature music, mostly self-penned, all in that vein. His 3rd CD, "All Of Your Love" is a passionate and emotional journey unto J.B.'s musical world. His long awaited 4th and 5th CD, "Makin' The Deal Go Down" and

"Acoustic Sensibility" are here!

J.B. worked hard and long to try and produce sounds to equal his heralded early efforts, and we think he has done it!!

​J.B. Kline has been known to say, "I'd rather squeeze a pound of soul into 1 note, than to play 250 notes! You’ve gotta feel it or it don’t mean nothin’ at all.” As anyone who’s been to one of his performances can tell you, J.B. Kline definitely “feels it” when he is singing and playing his guitar -- and you can feel it too! His stark emotional style of music takes him, and you, to exciting, almost orgasmic places. J.B. Kline is worth seeing, hearing and feeling!

View Event →

Charlie Don't Surf

Charlie Don’t Surf was created by Jeff and Pete, long time partners in Mobius Strip. Wanting to create funky, earthy jam music they searched for a drummer and the right one found them. Or more appropriately, they found each other.

Andrew, delivering a keg to their studio, admired the vintage “half stacks” and conversation led to a jam, the musical connection immediate. Looking for the right bass player to bring it home found Christian, a jazzy, funky player, the unit complete.

Charlie Don’t Surf covers funky songs and if a choice is not funky the band funks it up. Charlie “does the song” but “does it our way.” Jamming, flipping the beat around, “pushing the one” is what the band is about.

All write songs but Charlie Don’t Surf is an “original cover band” that covers the song but makes it their own, creatively satisfying for them and their audience.

View Event →

Joe Cirotti Trio

Joe Cirotti Trio, a well-oiled string band from the shadows of Northwest Jersey’s Appalachian ridge, fuses their multi-instrumentalist upbringings with a passion for the roots of American folk, jazz, country, and bluegrass. Their bond is rooted in proximity, strengthened by a blue-collar passion for picking, and buoyed by their shared propensity for roots music and whiskey.

Formed in 2015, the current line-up of Joe Cirotti: guitar, Pete Lister: upright bass, and Timmy Coyle: mandolin and guitar, continues to craft a sound steeped in tradition yet infused with modern twists.

The group also occasionally plays as a 4/5-piece ensemble, adding banjo, fiddle, dobro, percussion, or even more mandolin, often joined by founding member Mike Alexander.

Joe Cirotti Trio has become a fixture at premier area venues across the NWNJ area, and is booking into the summer and fall across a wider area. Their debut release, “Joe Cirotti Trio”, launched on CD and Vinyl in December 2023, and streaming on all major platforms.

They find common musical ground in influences like Doc Watson, Tony Rice, and Garcia/Grisman, but also as diverse as Django Reinhardt, Pink Floyd, and Van Halen. This stirs up a one-of-a-kind blend of Americana, bluegrass, alt-country, and gypsy jazz, and acoustic pop.

View Event →

Bryan Hansen band

BRYAN HANSEN BAND

Meet Bryan Hansen Band, hailing from Central New Jersey (it does exist). Their music, as defined by Lenny Green of WBLS, is a soulful concoction dubbed "Blue Eyed Soul," blending funky rhythms with bluesy vibes and soulful melodies.

From the Jersey Shore to iconic venues like Bowery Electric NYC and the House of Blues Anaheim, these guys have been Making America Funk Again. They've even graced the legendary Troubadour in West Hollywood and been featured at Winter NAMM 2020 & 2024 and SoFar Sounds D.C. & NYC.

From their debut EP in 2009 Ebb & Flow EP 2009, the band has released 4 LP's including Brothers Among Wolves 2013, When You Stop Pulling Back 2016, Gas Money 2019 and most recently, Jammin with Dr. Fong LP 2024.

Drawing inspiration from legends like Stevie Wonder, Dave Matthews Band, and Victor Wooten, Bryan Hansen Band infuses their music with soulful influences that resonate with audiences.

Bryan Hansen Band is proudly endorsed by Godin Guitars and BG France.

Check out their latest album, 'Jammin with Dr. Fong' available on all streaming platforms.

View Event →

Cold In Hand

Cold In Hand

Veterans of the Tri-state Blues scene, Bob Lanza and Al Gold join forces in a new group they call, “Cold In Hand”. Both are singers, songwriters, guitarists and recording artists with their own sound, vision and inspiration. Playing from NYC, NJ to Texas, New Orleans and back again, their energetic up tempo style connects with any age audience. Come check out “Cold in Hand” to see for yourself.

View Event →

TBD

TBD

View Event →

Craig Sailer Project

We are a multi-award winner, family friendly, fun, grooving old school rock and roll band. We love to interact with our clients, fans and friends and always have a great time. You will not be disappointed.

View Event →

Michael Glabicki & Dirk Miller

Multi Platnium, award winning artist, singer songwriter, Michale Glabicki of Rusted Root.

Purchase tickets with the link below.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/michael-glabicki-dirk-miller-of-rusted-root-tickets-916586935197?aff=ebdssbdestsearch

Michael Glabicki of Rusted Root

Michael Glabicki, lead singer, songwriter and guitarist for Rusted Root fuses musical mastery and shamanic inspiration into his music and live performances. In his most prolific period to date Glabicki is focusing his energy on his new band, The UPROOTED Band, to carry on the legacy of Rusted Root’s energetic music while recording new music for their debut album due out next Spring.

“Uprooted has masterfully expanded the landscape of the older Rusted Root songs and created a new intuitive and magnetic vision of the material” says Glabicki, “These inspired performances not only energize and expand the hearts of the crowds but also show us how to take the new music to the next level”.

Rusted Root, lead by Michael, built their career around dramatic performances; their polyrhythmic, multicultural rock-and-soul picked up fans like a junkyard magnet as they swept across the nation on tour. Glabicki continues to keep this tradition alive through his new project, The Uprooted Band.

The Uprooted Band Featuring Michael Glabicki of Rusted Root

With Dirk Miller on guitar and vocals, Ricky Petraglia on drums, Keaton Thandi on percussion, Erik Kramer on bass and Daisie Ghost Flower and Emily Victoria on background vocals, The Uprooted Band is a liberating project for Glabicki. He says "I looked to the past and imagined where I wanted to go and realized this band is the perfect vehicle to take me there.” This tour will focus on the energy and excitement Rusted Root brought to all of their fans, and keep the spirit of the music moving forward.

Michael Glabicki of Rusted Root with Dirk Miller Duo Show

In addition to the full band, Glabicki strips down to the bare essentials on a duo tour where he and long-time bandmate Dirk Miller take the old Rusted Root favorites along with new material and perform re-envisioned versions of them in an up close and intimate setting.

“We go into the crevices of the songs and expand them out and open up the music to whatever happens in the moment,” Glabicki says of his shows with Miller. “It’s completely improvisational, to the point where we surprise ourselves a lot. Things just happen, and I start laughing. It’s like we’ve never heard it sound like that before. We have a great time with it and the audience seems to enjoy the musical exploration too.”

A multifaceted musician, producer and songwriter, Glabicki’s talents are unique and extremely uplifting. His new projects and music are extensions of his creative talent, and will inspire all those who participate. Tour dates and additional information can be found on Glabicki’s website and social platforms.

View Event →

The Toll Collectors

Christina Alessi and the Toll Collectors are a quintet led by a seasoned storyteller who sings from the heart. We counted off our first song in late 2014 in a former industrial building on the Jersey side of the Holland Tunnel. They say that friends are the family you choose, and our music is an extension of our bond.

And how do we sound? (Ah, every band’s favorite question.) Like rain on the windshield during a late-night drive. Or a jukebox sing-along in a neighborhood dive. A bit of country, rock, and soul. But something else, too. Heartbroken, yet defiant. Down, but never out. Resolute.

It might help to mention that there’s violin and mandolin, a lead vocalist who thrives on connecting with audiences large and small, and four more singers who pile on the harmonies. I guess you could call it Americana music. But why not just listen?

View Event →

Sheire Project

What if John Mayer and Stevie Ray Vaughn had a child? It would be The Scheier (shy-er) Project. Hit the nail on the head with that description, however it left out the fact that these guys just straight F$$$ing rock, and the set lists are fun, diverse and unique. Not your typical BS cover band. Come out, eat, drink, and get your bell rung

View Event →

Darren Demarco & The Untimley Gentelman

The brain behind the infamous “Rock the Vets”charity raising money for Veterans Haven North in lebanon NJ.

An infectious quartet of untimely gentlemen delivering quality music directly to your ear canal. We specialize in obscure tunes. Not your average band.

View Event →

Joe Cirotti Trio

Jimmy Leahey & Gray Man Group

Jimmy Leahy started playing guitar at age 7, learning from his dad, Harry... a well-known jazz player and a prolific teacher in New Jersey. Jimmy’s toured and recorded with John Waite, Patty Smyth, Martha Davis, Gloria Gaynor, Alison Krauss and has just retired from playing with Dennis DeYoung, from Styx

One of the most optimistic and genuine guys you’ll meet, Jimmy talks about the incredible positive influence his dad had on him, and also the pressure he often felt being “Harry’s son”... a great story about the best gig he had, playing as part of the house band for Bon Jovi’s birthday party - playing alongside Roger Waters, Billy Joel, and Paul McCartney…

View Event →

Eelctric Mayhem

Meet "The Electric Mayhem," the ultimate rock cover band bringing you the best hits from the 80s hard rock, 90s alternative, and 2000s pop punk scenes. With a passion for high-energy performances and a commitment to delivering an authentic rock experience, The Electric Mayhem has been electrifying audiences across the region.

From the soaring choruses of 80s hard rock classics to the introspective melodies of 90s alternative, and the infectious hooks of 2000s pop punk, The Electric Mayhem covers it all. Their setlist is a carefully curated journey through the eras that defined modern rock, ensuring there's something for everyone to rock out to.

Whether you're reliving your youth or discovering these timeless tracks for the first time, The Electric Mayhem delivers a show that's as nostalgic as it is exhilarating. Get ready to raise your fists, sing along, and experience the rebellion of rock and roll with The Electric Mayhem!

View Event →

Allan Willcockson

Alan and his band coming live from Pattenbirg House with a full range of country and folk classics.

View Event →

Creeping Charlie

Known as the ultimate wild party band, Creeping Charlie delivers a high-energy rock and roll experience that will have everyone dancing and singing along. With a dynamic mix of crowd-pleasing covers and electrifying original songs, this band knows how to turn any venue into an unforgettable celebration. Renowned for their passion and talent, Creeping Charlie loves nothing more than performing and spreading joy through their music. Whether it's a packed club, a backyard bash, or a festival stage, they'll have you losing your shirt and loving every minute of it!

View Event →

Snakman Runyan's Blues Jam

Come on out and join Snakeman and the boys for a good old-fashioned of blues jam. Come and join the band or just sit and enjoy the tunes. This is one of our favorite days of the month!

View Event →

Gearbox

A classic rock cover band, check out their facebook page for more info.

Tony & the Trees

Tony & the Trees making their Pattenburg House Debut. They will be bringing their blend of Soul, Blues and Americana to our stage. We hope you’ll join us.

View Event →

This Old Engine

All aboard! Calling all DEADHEADS, TOE back for thier monthy residency. The momentum is monumental, TOE constantly pushes the F***ing limits on what a tribute band can do, we are always blown away. Sleep laater, dance now!

$10 Cover - 7-10pm

View Event →

Jesse Bardwell & The Noble Brothers

About Jesse: Jesse Bardwell’s dual passions for music and the outdoors are intrinsically linked, having fueled his existence for as long as he can remember. A multi-instrumentalist whose songwriting lends itself to traditional country, rock, bluegrass and Americana, Bardwell is equally at home on stage as he is spending the day solo fly-fishing on a lazy river.

Jesse will be playing with The Noble Brothers

View Event →

Maura Glynn Band

Maura Glynn, Pattenburg favorite, brings us another night of music and fun. Playing her soulful mix of originals and covers.

View Event →

DJ Tobasco - Hip Hop Party!

Join us at The Pattenburg House as we crank up the volume and ignite the dance floor with our electrifying Hip Hop Hype Night! Get ready to experience an unforgettable evening of pulsating beats, epic rhymes, and non-stop grooving that will make your heart race and feet move.

More details coming soon!

View Event →

JB Kline

JB Kline is an absolute legend - learn more on his facebook page.

View Event →

Brian Molnar Band

“BRIAN MOLNAR & THE Naked Hearts/Of the Fall: These Brooklyn cowboys should make Jack Elliot proud as they continue to push the boundaries of Americana in sound and spirit beyond what has become an ossification too frequent in the form. Fusing, pop, country, folk and concise lyrics that hit hard and fast tied together with Arlo Guthrie inspired vocals, this is grand folk music for now times. Put it this way, if you play this in the car, you might find yourself hitting the eject button less often than you think when the 11 tracks have run their course. Well done. ” - Chris Spector

View Event →

Caren Kennedy & Friends

Caren Kennedy is back!!! She and her friends will be getting you up and out of your seats with their genre bending funky mix of songs. This show is a celebration in honor of Carens’ and the friends she has chosen for this one will make it one to remember! Come check it out and start the weekend off right.

View Event →

Bryan Hansen Band

Bryan Hansen Band's sound is a mix of funk, rock, soul and R&B with music influences from Stevie Wonder, Dave Matthews Band, John Mayer, Al Green and Victor Wooten. They're proudly endorsed by Godin Guitars & BG France.

One of the most optimistic and genuine guys you’ll meet, Jimmy talks about the incredible positive influence his dad had on him, and also the pressure he often felt being “Harry’s son”... a great story about the best gig he had, playing as part of the house band for Bon Jovi’s birthday party - playing alongside Roger Waters, Billy Joel, and Paul McCartney…

The Joe Cirotti Trio

We cordially invite you to Sunday Service with The Joe Cirotti Trio.

View Event →

The Decoy Clones

Four Seasoned Musicians who joined together to entertain you with great classic rock music. Don’t miss the return of this rocking band to the Pattenburg House Stage

Snakeman Runyans Blues Jam

Come on out and join Snakeman and the boys for a good old-fashioned of blues jam. Come and join the band or just sit and enjoy the tunes. This is one of our favorite days of the month!

View Event →

The Drive

Hunterdon County-based classic rock band with a high-energy set list spanning Eric Clapton and Joe Cocker to Bonnie Raitt and the Stones. You gonna want to get out your seat and dance in your pants. This female vocal driven band is nothing short of miraculous. Come in, sit, eat, drink, and enjoy.

View Event →

Craig Sailor Project

The Craig Sailer Project (CSP) comes out of Hunterdon County, NJ, USA and has been playing together for many years. The lineup may change from time to time but the style is always rocking. I have been involved in music most of my life and is always experimenting with new sounds and is constantly writing new music.

I play guitar as well as sings and do most of the recording and engineering at his home studio. The style of CSP is a touch of southern rock, classic rock, blues, sweet rock ballets and old school rock and roll.

The Craig Sailer Project is a working rock and roll band playing cover music and we are currently in the studio and recording new music. The Craig Sailer Project has received many awards for our music (including local band of the year from Zuma press and winner of the April 2021 Rock Music Award from Academia) as well as finalist (6 times) in the World Songwriting Awards competition over the last several years.

View Event →

Califon Hellbenders

The Califon Hellbenders are middle aged guys in a band, built for fun, not speed, who love playing for our friends and neighbors and celebrating our community. What is a Hellbender? Simply put, it is a type of salamander found in the eastern United States. But the reason for this name is not just our love of regional amphibians, but rather that word just sounds like pure Rock & Roll, with an easygoing vibe that suits our persona. We describe our style as “good time folk-a-billy jam pop dance party rock”, with unconventional instrumentation that weaves together the acoustic and electric, old timey and modern, with a pulsating undercurrent of tasty banjo ever-present. And it suggests a certain bendy looseness of musical interpretation inherent in our exploration of favorite tunes from across pretty much any genre, with a particular soft

spot for ‘80s rock & pop, ballads, B-side classic rock, Grateful Dead, and Kenny Loggins. Mostly from the fair borough of Califon (Jason Beard, Brian Goad, and Dan Hemberger), with imported bass and vocal skills via Pat Walsh from Lawrenceville. We play what we like, which given our collective 200 years’+ of living experience, can cover a lot of ground. The Hellbenders try to give people a reason to get their bodies moving, but are also known to explore the soft underbelly of music across these genres. You’ve heard a lot of these tunes, and we’re guessing there are some you have not. Even if you have, you may not recognize them at first. Have fun with it! All we promise is a really good time.

View Event →

CC Coletti

CC, a New Jersey native, started singing and creating music at a young age. Her main influences are: Janis Joplin, Robert Plant, and Aretha Franklin. CC has two solo releases, Woodstock Lane, released in 2008, and her sophomore release, Let It All Hang Out in 2013. In addition to her second solo release in 2013, she recorded Bring It On Home with Chesky Records, a modern play on Led Zeppelin songs. Her latest release is a single with Anthony Krizan, called Crazy.

The CC Coletti Band has been the opening act for: The Doobie Brothers, Meat Loaf, The Outlaws, Brett Michaels, The Smithereens, South Side Johnny and The Asbury Jukes, and more.

View Event →
